dataset.title: Alaskan Peatland Experiment: Community structure and productivity data for 2007-2010 X - Leaf Area

address.deliveryPoint: Biology and Wildlife Irving I; North Koyukuk Dr.
Department of Integrative Biology University of Guelph
Alaska Cooperative Fish and Wildlife Research Unit University of Alaska Fairbanks Irving I Building
Boreal Ecology Cooperative Research Unit, PNW Research Station, USDA Forest Service, P.O. Box 756780,University of Alaska Fairbanks

abstract.para: This dataset contains surface area measurements for all vascular species present within a plot with an abundance greater than 5%. Surface area measurements at the fen include 2008-2010, while at the bog are for 2009-2010. Within the fen site a water table manipulation has been ongiong since 2005, with control, lowered and raised water table treatment plots. Samples at the bog were collected in a plot established within the lowland black spruce permafrost plateau (permafrost), and two plots established within collapse scars embedded within the plateau. One collapse scar formed ~ 45 years ago (old collapse) and the other formed ~ 25 years ago based upon aerial photography provided by the BCEF LTER. The data provided in this data set can be sorted by site and plot.

section.title: Access to Data
section.para: While metadata will be freely available to those requesting it, the data manager will assure that any restrictions on access to data sets in the database will be enforced. Data will not be released without proper permission first being obtained from the investigator who generated the data.

section.title: Use of data
section.para: Researchers should receive adequate acknowledgment for the use of their data by others and should be provided with copies of publications using their data. Users of data from the data base must be aware that data is not to be sold or redistributed.

section.title: Citing Bonanza Creek LTER Datasets
section.para: It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists. Thus, the Data User will properly cite the Data Set in any publications or in the metadata of any derived data products that were produced using the Data Set.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: lowland open fen with daily access during the growing season

section.title: Experimental Design
section.para: The bog site contains 3 plots, one in an area of stable permafrost (Permafrost plot), one in a thermokarst collapse scar ~45 years old and another collapse scar ~ 25 years old. At the fen site there are three water table manipulation plots ( control, lowered, and raised) with 3 open top chambers nested within each plot (data from OTCs was not collected, unless otherwise noted).

section.title: Methods
section.para: FIELD: Leaf area measurements of dominant species were conducted every two weeks throughout the growing season to calculate changes in photosynthetic surface area. For the first three leaf area measurements in 2009 I quantified lengths and widths for all leaves using a caliper on three individuals of each dominant species within a plot. Leaf area calculations were based upon geometric equations for leaf shape approximations (Chivers et al., 2009; Wilson et al., 2007). These non destructive measurements were compared to a destructive approach, whereby I harvested three to five individuals for each species within each plot during three sampling dates in 2009. In 2010 all leaf area measurements were calculated using destructive harvest of three individuals per dominant species within a plot followed by measurement of leaf area using the LI-3000C. LAB: Specimens that were destructively harvested in 2009 and 2010 were measured for surface area by scanning all leaves with a LI-3000C Portable Leaf Area Meter (LI-COR, Lincoln, Nebraska). These two methods yielded similar estimates of surface area in 2009.

section.title: Sampling Frequency
section.para: Measurements of leaf area were collected either in the field every two weeks, or on samples that were collected every two weeks during the growing season. Leaf area was measured only at the fen in 2008, and at the bog and fen in 2009 and 2010.
